>So said Nikunj Manocha on 2003-07-08 --------------------
>Hi All,
>
>  I =
am only doing a comparison study to why  our project development 
>team sho=
uld use JUnit. JUnit testing is ingrained deeply into our 
>development env=
ironment.
>  I was wondering whether there is any other testing tool availa=
ble 
>which follows the concept of writing test code first? What features 
=
>does JUnit offer over those test tools?
>  Any information regarding these=
 shall be very helpfull.

I don't have any specific references; however, I'=
ll argue that JUnit is the representative implementation of unit testing wi=
th these requirements.

1. Tests must be automatic -- I push one button and=
 they run.
2. Tests must verify themselves -- the test decides for itself w=
hether it passes.
3. It must be possible to collect any group of tests into=
 a suite.

If you start with these requirements, start writing tests, then =
factor out the repetitive parts, you'll get something very close to JUnit.
=

I would like to carry out this experiment sometime, but only as a Pair, be=
cause if I do it myself, my bias will lead to JUnit.

Take care.


J. B. Ra=
insberger,

eople understand.
